alerts.description:
At 534 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16
miles west of Crane, moving northeast at 30 mph.

Penny size hail and wind gusts up to 50 mph will be possible with
this storm.

This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Crane
County.

A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for
western Texas.
alerts.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 5:34PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX

alerts.description:
At 531 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 17 miles southeast
of Grandfalls, or 21 miles southwest of Crane, moving east northeast
at 20 mph.

HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail
damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind
damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

Locations impacted include...
Cordona Lake and Imperial.
alerts.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 10 at 5:31PM CDT until April 10 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX

alerts.description:
THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH
99 IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING AREAS

IN TEXAS THIS WATCH INCLUDES 9 COUNTIES

IN SOUTHWEST TEXAS

BREWSTER              JEFF DAVIS            PECOS
REEVES                TERRELL

IN WESTERN TEXAS

CRANE                 REAGAN                UPTON
WARD

THIS INCLUDES THE CITIES OF ALPINE, BIG LAKE, CRANE, DRYDEN,
FORT DAVIS, FORT STOCKTON, MCCAMEY, MONAHANS, PECOS, RANKIN,
AND SANDERSON.
alerts.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch issued April 10 at 3:42PM CDT until April 10 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
